name: Sketch: Woodlands
description:
This is a proof-of-concept for a point-and-click game engine I'm working on; it only takes about five minutes to play through. The artwork is all hand-drawn pen sketches that I scanned and colored in on the computer.

To move around, just click on the ground wherever you want to go. White icons appear over some objects; when you're standing close enough, you can click the icon to interact with it.

The game engine is inspired by bitsy. My goal was to make an engine with similar capabilities for quickly creating simple games and interactive stories, but using hand-drawn sketches instead of pixel art.

Note: this game might not work in older browsers, and does not seem to work in Safari. It should work in newer versions of Chrome or Firefox.
